description: MCP Operator - Production-Ready Monitoring with Protocol Intelligence

panels.description: 95th percentile of operator reconciliation loop duration. High values indicate the operator is taking longer to process MCPServer resource changes. Values above 2s (red) may indicate performance issues.
panels.title: Reconcile Latency (P95)

panels.description: Rate of reconciliation operations per second across all MCPServer resources. This shows how actively the operator is processing changes and updates.
panels.title: Reconcile Rate

panels.description: Rate of failed reconciliation attempts. Any value above 0 indicates the operator is encountering errors while processing MCPServer resources and requires investigation.
panels.title: Reconcile Errors

panels.description: Time series showing operator reconciliation duration at different percentiles (P50, P95, P99). Track performance trends over time to identify degradation. Spikes indicate the operator is struggling to process changes quickly.
panels.title: Operator Reconciliation Performance

panels.description: Reconciliation operations per second broken down by success vs error. Helps identify when the operator started encountering issues and the proportion of failing reconciliations.
panels.title: Operator Reconciliation Rate by Result

panels.description: Total number of MCPServer resources currently managed by the operator. This represents the size of your MCP server fleet.
panels.title: Total Servers

panels.description: Number of MCPServer resources in ready state with all health checks passing. This should ideally match the total server count.
panels.title: Ready Servers

panels.description: Total number of pod replicas across all MCPServer deployments. Includes all replicas regardless of their ready state.
panels.title: Total Replicas

panels.description: Number of MCPServer resources in Failed phase. Non-zero values indicate servers that encountered unrecoverable errors and need attention.
panels.title: Failed Servers

panels.description: Number of MCPServer resources with Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) enabled. HPA automatically scales replicas based on CPU/memory usage.
panels.title: HPA Enabled

panels.description: Number of MCPServer resources with HPA disabled. These servers have fixed replica counts that must be manually adjusted.
panels.title: HPA Disabled

panels.description: Distribution of MCPServer lifecycle phases over time (Creating, Running, Scaling, Updating, Failed, Terminating, ValidationFailed). Track server health and identify problematic state transitions.
panels.title: Server Phase Distribution Over Time

panels.description: Number of MCPServer resources that successfully validated against the MCP protocol specification. These servers are correctly implementing MCP requirements.
panels.title: Protocol Compliant

panels.description: Number of MCPServer resources that failed MCP protocol validation. These servers have protocol compliance issues that should be addressed.
panels.title: Non-Compliant

panels.description: Number of servers currently in ValidationFailed phase. These servers could not start due to validation errors and require configuration fixes.
panels.title: Validation Failed

panels.description: 95th percentile of MCP protocol validation duration. High latency may slow down server deployment. Values above 5s indicate validation performance issues.
panels.title: Validation Latency (P95)

panels.description: Rate of MCP protocol validation checks per second. Higher rates occur during server creation and updates when protocol compliance must be verified.
panels.title: Validation Rate

panels.description: Rate of validation process errors (not protocol violations). Non-zero values indicate the validator itself is encountering technical problems.
panels.title: Validation Errors

panels.description: Trend of protocol-compliant vs non-compliant servers over time. Track compliance improvements or regressions as you deploy and update servers.
panels.title: Protocol Compliance Over Time

panels.description: Rate of specific validation issues grouped by error code. Helps identify which MCP protocol requirements are most commonly violated.
panels.title: Validation Issues by Code

panels.description: Distribution of MCP protocol versions in use across your fleet (e.g., 2024-11-05 for SSE, 2025-03-26+ for Streamable HTTP). Tracks protocol adoption.
panels.title: Protocol Version Distribution

panels.description: Count of servers implementing each MCP capability (tools, resources, prompts, etc.). Shows which MCP features are most widely deployed.
panels.title: Servers with Each Capability

panels.description: Total MCP request rate across all sidecar proxies. Shows overall traffic volume flowing through the MCP infrastructure.
panels.title: Request Rate

panels.description: Rate of failed MCP requests across all sidecar proxies. Indicates issues with MCP protocol communication or backend server problems.
panels.title: Error Rate

panels.description: 95th percentile of MCP request duration through sidecar proxies. High values indicate slow server responses or network issues. Values above 0.5s need investigation.
panels.title: Request Latency (P95)

panels.description: Total number of active client connections to MCP sidecar proxies. Represents current concurrent users or applications connected to your MCP servers.
panels.title: Active Connections

panels.description: 95th percentile request latency broken down by individual MCPServer. Identify which servers are experiencing performance issues.
panels.title: Request Latency P95 per MCPServer

panels.description: Request error rate per MCPServer. Quickly identify which servers are experiencing the most failures.
panels.title: Error Rate per MCPServer

panels.description: Top 10 most frequently called MCP tools. Shows which tools are most valuable to your users and helps prioritize optimization efforts.
panels.title: Top 10 Most Used Tools

panels.description: Top 10 most frequently accessed MCP resources. Indicates which data sources are most critical for your MCP workflows.
panels.title: Top 10 Most Used Resources

panels.description: Request traffic per MCPServer over time. Compare server utilization and identify load imbalances across your fleet.
panels.title: Request Rate per MCPServer

panels.description: Active connection count per MCPServer. Shows user distribution across servers and helps identify capacity constraints.
panels.title: Active Connections per MCPServer

title: MCP Operator - Protocol Intelligence
